alert.note: Alert for Southwest Wyoming (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 6:33PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Weber...southern Cache...east central Box Elder...southern Rich...northeastern Davis...Morgan...northwestern Summit and west central Uinta Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 632 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Marriott-Slaterville to 6 miles north of Coalville. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ogden, Logan, Brigham City, Evanston, Morgan, Coalville, Roy, North Ogden, South Ogden, Washington Terrace, Riverdale, Hyrum, South Weber, Perry, Wellsville, Willard, Marriott-Slaterville, Uintah, Mantua and Weber State University. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 340 and 367. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 84 between mile markers 88 and 119. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 164 and 196. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
